intro: Centaurea pestalozzae, commonly known as the Pestalozza's knapweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its erect stem and clusters of bright yellow to orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Centaurea pestalozzae is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
